projects.title: Sentiment Taxonomy Definition and Dataset Construction for Usability Research
projects.description: This project aims to define a scientifically grounded sentiment and affect taxonomy specifically tailored to usability and UX research, and to construct a high-quality annotated dataset to support reliable sentiment analysis in RUXAILAB. The work addresses current limitations of generic facial sentiment models by identifying which emotions, affective states, and reactions are meaningful in usability contexts (e.g., frustration, confusion, satisfaction, cognitive overload).
keyFeatures: State-of-the-Art Review: Analyze existing sentiment, emotion, and affect models used in HCI, UX, and Affective Computing
Usability-Oriented Sentiment Taxonomy: Define a reduced and meaningful set of emotions and affective states relevant to usability studies
Annotation Guidelines: Design clear annotation protocols suitable for facial, vocal, and textual data
Dataset Construction: Build and curate a multimodal dataset (face, voice, text) aligned with usability testing scenarios
Ethics and Anonymization: Ensure compliance with ethical standards and privacy regulations
projects.expectedOutcome: A validated sentiment taxonomy and a high-quality annotated dataset specifically designed for usability and UX research, enabling more accurate and meaningful sentiment analysis in RUXAILAB.

projects.title: Multimodal Sentiment Analysis Engine for Usability Studies
projects.description: This project focuses on designing and implementing a multimodal sentiment analysis engine that combines facial expressions, voice signals, and textual transcriptions to infer user affective states during usability tests. The system will leverage the usability-oriented sentiment taxonomy defined in RUXAILAB and provide explainable outputs suitable for research and reporting.
keyFeatures: Facial Sentiment Analysis Refinement: Improve existing facial emotion models using the new usability-oriented dataset
Voice-Based Emotion Recognition: Extract emotional cues from prosody, tone, and speech patterns
Textual Sentiment and Intent Analysis: Analyze transcriptions, task answers, and comments using NLP techniques
Multimodal Fusion Strategies: Combine face, voice, and text signals into a unified sentiment inference model
Explainable Outputs: Provide confidence scores and modality-specific contributions for transparency
projects.expectedOutcome: A research-grade multimodal sentiment analysis engine that produces reliable and explainable affective insights tailored to usability testing scenarios.

projects.title: Voice and Speech Analysis for Emotion and Cognitive State Detection
projects.description: This project aims to analyze users’ voice recordings captured during usability tests to extract emotional cues, stress indicators, and cognitive states. The focus is on leveraging speech and paralinguistic features to complement facial and textual sentiment analysis in RUXAILAB.
keyFeatures: Speech Feature Extraction: Extract prosodic, spectral, and temporal features from voice recordings
Emotion and Stress Detection: Identify affective states such as frustration, hesitation, or confidence
Cognitive Load Indicators: Explore correlations between speech patterns and cognitive effort
Alignment with Transcriptions: Synchronize voice analysis with textual transcriptions and task timelines
Integration with RUXAILAB Pipelines: Store extracted features and predictions for reporting and analysis
projects.expectedOutcome: A voice analysis module that enriches usability studies with emotional and cognitive insights derived from speech.

projects.title: Intent and Semantic Analysis of Transcriptions and User Answers
projects.description: This project focuses on extracting user intent, expectations, and perceived issues from transcriptions, open-ended answers, and moderator-user dialogues. The goal is to move beyond sentiment polarity and identify what users are trying to achieve, where they struggle, and how they interpret the interface.
keyFeatures: Intent Detection Models: Identify user goals, misunderstandings, and expressed needs from text
Semantic Topic Extraction: Automatically detect recurring usability issues and themes
Methodology-Aware Analysis: Adapt NLP outputs to usability testing, interviews, and post-task questionnaires
Explainable NLP Outputs: Provide traceable links between extracted intents and original text segments
Integration with Reporting: Generate structured insights for usability reports
projects.expectedOutcome: An NLP-based intent and semantic analysis module that converts raw transcriptions into actionable usability insights.

projects.title: Sentiment and Emotion Output Standardization for Usability Reports
projects.description: This project aims to define and implement standardized output formats for sentiment, emotion, and intent analysis results, ensuring they can be consistently integrated into RUXAILAB reports and dashboards.
keyFeatures: Standard Output Schemas: Define JSON structures for sentiment, emotion, and intent outputs
Severity and Confidence Scoring: Normalize confidence levels and intensity indicators
Methodology Compatibility: Adapt outputs to different usability evaluation methods
Human-Readable Summaries: Generate concise textual explanations for reports
Integration with Existing Reporting Tools: Plug into RUXAILAB’s reporting pipeline
projects.expectedOutcome: A consistent and reusable output layer that improves clarity, comparability, and interpretability of sentiment-related results.
